While I am recommending HL, I didn't play it until after playing HL2 and some HL2 mods.  Had I played HL before HL2, I probably wouldn't have tried HL2.  HL is glitchy...  the basic settings cause you to bounce up when climbing ladders, move too far when jumping from place to place, get stuck in walls, snag and get stuck on stairway banisters.  It gets very frustrating.  When it plays smoothly, it's fun but difficult even in easy mode.  I kept getting stuck in levels and not able to find my way out, until I finally decided to find a walk-thru to follow and put myself in god mode so I didn't die all the time.  HL2 is far superior in graphics and story.  Even Black Mesa is far superior...  however, if you really want a challenge, go for it, but if you have never played any of the HL games, do not let it stop you from progressing to the other games in the series.  Do yourself a favor though, have a walk-thru ready because you will no doubt find yourself running in circles and getting frustrated.

Классика жанра.Шутер,зародивший тренд на сюжет и кинематографичность.Шутер,перевернувший игровую индустрию.Но всё-же сейчас играется немного душновато,но это никак не косяк разработчиков.Больше мне особо нечего сказать.Легендарная игра с огромным лором,игра доказавшая,что видеоигры-это не только бездумные пострелушки.

It's like 3 games of luck in a trenchcoat posing as a game of skill. Its logo should appear in the dictionary next to the word "overrated."

Edit: Now that I've beaten the game I'd like to clarify: it still sucks. Mechanically, Quake handled both shooting and platforming better about 2 years before this came out. In terms of puzzles, it tends to rely on patience and trial and error more than actual wit and creativity. I even enjoyed Dark Souls 2 and this game still had too many cheap deaths for me. I wholeheartedly resent that this put Valve on the map.
The original HL is much less buggy than the Source version, and imo looks better anyway.
